entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 19 at 11:13AM AKST until December 20 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 6:40AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM TO IMPACT WESTERN KENAI PENINSULA, ANCHORAGE, AND THE MAT-SU VALLEYS MONDAY... Snow is expected to develop Monday morning from the Western Kenai Peninsula north to the Mat-Su Valleys. The snow is expected to start off as wet snow before transitioning to a drier, more powdery snow by Monday afternoon or evening. Snowfall rates are
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 4:06AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated water levels along the West Coast Sunday and Monday... A strong weather system moving to the West Coast will bring elevated water levels to the coast south of the Bering Strait Sunday night and Monday and north of the Bering Strait on Monday. Water levels are expected to be 3 to 6 feet above the normal high tide line. Water levels will be similar to the system that brought
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.summary: ...Multiple Winter Storms to Impact Holiday Mountain Travel Tuesday through the Weekend... .A series of winter storms will bring multiple rounds of moderate to heavy mountain snow and gusty winds Tuesday through Sunday. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 2:26AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STORMY WEATHER RETURNS WITH TRAVEL IMPACTS STARTING TUESDAY, LIKELY EXTENDING THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE YEAR.... A series of Pacific winter storms will bring periods of stormy weather to much of California and Nevada next week. There will be few, if any, meaningful breaks in the weather for the Sierra once the storms begin on Tuesday, so plan ahead.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 2:26AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STORMY WEATHER RETURNS WITH TRAVEL IMPACTS STARTING TUESDAY, LIKELY EXTENDING THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE YEAR.... A series of Pacific winter storms will bring periods of stormy weather to much of California and Nevada next week. There will be few, if any, meaningful breaks in the weather for the Sierra once the storms begin on Tuesday, so plan ahead.
